text:
In working-class San Francisco, a teacher prides himself on pushing students to pass the World History exam, forcing elite schools to take them seriously.

But with school shuttered, he and his students lose their way. Can they find it before exam day? https://t.co/phDkIF9qt9

name: washingtonpost
text:
Investigation: Police partially blinded 8 people in one day at George Floyd protests.

The Post found video evidence undermining official accounts. https://t.co/V914lIIMtU

name: washingtonpost
text:
Of the eight who lost sight that day, six were protesters, one was a photojournalist, and another was a passerby.

Drawing on cellphone and surveillance videos, The Post reconstructed the circumstances of three of those incidents in detail. https://t.co/P914N7I0dr

name: washingtonpost
text: Watch our video to see what happened — and to compare it with the official accounts of those incidents and with police department rules on when officers are permitted to use force. https://t.co/WWe8JSBRBi
